subject: Travel
title: Why We Still Explore
description: Learn Why We Still Explore in one minute.

hook.text: Every corner of the map is filled in. Every mountain is climbed. So why do we still explore?

buildup.text: Scientists estimate 86% of Earth's species haven't been discovered yet. Most live in oceans and soil.

discovery.text: Cave systems, deep oceans, and dense jungles still hold secrets no human has ever seen.

twist.text: In 2023, a new species of whale was identified â€” the world's largest animals still surprise us.

climax.text: The urge to explore isn't about filling maps. It's about asking what we haven't thought to look for.

punchline.text: We haven't run out of world. We've run out of eyes.

quiz.question: What percentage of Earth's species are estimated to be undiscovered?
